meanings.definition: Metal or rubber projections on the sole of a shoe for added traction.
meanings.sent1: The soccer player's cleats helped him run faster on the field.
meanings.sent2: She tied her cleats tightly before the big game.
meanings.sent3: The muddy field made the cleats slip and slide comically.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was the cleats that propelled her forward in life.
meanings.sent5: The cleats left distinct marks on the ground as he sprinted.

meanings.definition: A metal or wooden fitting on a spar or rail to which a rope can be secured.
meanings.sent1: The sailor quickly tied the rope to the cleats on the boat.
meanings.sent2: The cleats on the dock provided a secure anchor for the ship.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous seagull perched on the cleats, thinking it was a branch.
meanings.sent4: The cleats held onto the rope tightly, like a loyal friend.
meanings.sent5: The cleats gleamed in the sunlight, holding the boat steady.

meanings.definition: A wedge-shaped piece of wood or metal used to fasten or secure something.
meanings.sent1: He hammered the cleats into the wooden plank to secure it in place.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter used cleats to join the pieces of wood together.
meanings.sent3: The clever squirrel used the cleats as a makeshift nutcracker.
meanings.sent4: Her words acted as cleats, firmly holding his attention.
meanings.sent5: The cleats locked the door securely, keeping the room safe.
